Name: San Salvador
Description: The capital and largest city, known for its bustling urban life, historical sites, and economic importance as the heart of the country.

Name: Ahuachapan
Description: A region known for its coffee plantations, beautiful landscapes, and proximity to the Guatemalan border.

Name: Santa Ana
Description: This region is famous for its volcano, scenic lakes, and being one of the countryâ€™s most productive agricultural areas.

Name: La Libertad
Description: A coastal region known for its beaches, popular surf spots, and its importance as a tourist destination.

Name: Sonsonate
Description: A region known for its agricultural products, especially coffee, and beautiful natural landscapes.

Name: San Miguel
Description: The easternmost department of El Salvador, known for its agricultural production, especially sugarcane and tropical fruits.

Name: Morazan
Description: A rural region known for its forests, hills, and rivers, as well as its historical significance during the Salvadoran Civil War.

Name: Cabanas
Description: A region known for its mining industry, natural beauty, and important historical and cultural landmarks.
